intro: Asyneuma campanuloides, commonly known as the bluebell of the genus Asyneuma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many bell-shaped flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling small bells. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, arranged alternately along the stem. Asyneuma campanuloides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
